title: Where is IronStylus
body: With the Mount Targon short bios hitting the PBE, and my hope for  an incoming Mount Targon Lore Event plus {{champion:80}} VU, I am wondering where this amazing artist is and how his armor crafting skills will amaze us with {{champion:80}}'s VU. (wishful thinking?)

replies.body:
Hiya. Indeed, as the handsome and exotic Kindlejack said, I'm around. Indeed, I'll be back in force at some point I'm sure.

2015 was an interesting year to say the least. What occurred last year for me in my personal and professional life is still sort of reverberating beyond just those exclusive life events. I've had a lot to do, a lot to think about, and a lot to adjust to with the happenings of 2015. Honestly, everything that came out of last year put me in a better place, objectively speaking. I'm happier, stronger and more in touch with how I've grown and what I have to do to continue to do so. Growth comes from success and movement but also comes from loss and struggle. 

With those struggles, those times of muscle-tearing growth, friends like Kindlejack have been and continue to be indispensable. I've learned a lot from last year. The biggest being how the people in your life matter, in what capacity they matter, and how they either help you move forward, or drag you down. I'm lucky to say that in my life I'm surrounded by the former type of people. Those who've been a beacon of light, which not only has helped me move out of the dark, but shine in a way where I can see my reflection in a way I had not before. I've been looking out to the horizon, but very much looking at the person in the mirror.

That said, yep, I'm still here. Some things are the same, some things are different. Different as they may be, I'm looking forward in 2016 with a mindset of appreciation and cautious hope. Lots to do. Lots to say. 

Lots to be grateful for :)
It makes me happy every time I see your name pop up in the red-tracker. I've always loved the amount of your voice that shows in yours posts. Glad to see you again.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Geat to hear from you. And great to see that you're doing better

As a player I always felt like IronStylus' posts were tremendously humanising; they reminded me that Riot is a company full of real people with real opinions and lives. Now I have the privilege of working along side him every day and it's still kind of unreal. Let me just remind you, in his stead, that we are real people and sometimes real life just takes precedent over work - no matter how passionate you are. With that said I think he'll be back on the forums in due time. He certainly inspired me to be active here even before I joined Riot so the least I can do is return the favour >:P

Sometimes it can also be a little unclear what each of us do at Riot. I'm a concept artist on the Skins Team; that means that I spend almost all my time designing skins for champs. IronStylus is currently a concept artist on the Champ Update; so he's designing the new look for champions on the update roster. Foundations is the team that works on updating lore and world building, and they have their own cadre of awesome artists! Sometimes we change teams to bring new insights and experience, but that's where we are right now (and that's why I almost exclusively talk about skins).

As for Panth, of course, we definitely want to VU him but he's not in the works right now.

Thanks for the reply. I really appreciate the time you put into it. I've been on the forums before talking about {{champion:80}}, posting art designs and having some discussions with IronStylus himself. Please tell him I am a huge fan, to keep up the amazing work, he rocks, put pants on Panth lol, and thank you

Hey thanks for caring about our Targonian paragon! I can tell you that, because Panth right now is super generic and a little too familiar in his design, when he does get a VU there'll be some dramatic visual changes. I don't know what they are because he isn't being VU'd any time soon, but be prepared for change >:)

Pantheon will for sure need a full VGU and change pretty dramatically. He's a bit too genetic Spartan guy right now and really should be a unique version of LoL's embodiment of War. 

There are a few champions that need it more then him right now though. Hopefully with the larger size of the champ update team it's not TOO long before we get to him :)

Being as IronStylus is on the Champion Update team these days it's definitely a possibility he works on the concept art for pantheon.

Just for the sake of conversation; I really like the idea of turning Pantheon into a paragon of war as it gives him a much clearer identity than that of a simple warrior. That being said, don't {{champion:120}} AND {{champion:266}}  also represent avatars of War? There's a lot of symbolism in Hecarim's design relating to the horsemen of the apocalypse. And Aatrox`s entire concept is basically built around the idea that he revels in war and conflict. How would Pantheon's design resonate with that ideal without borrowing too heavily from Greek/Roman depictions of Ares or stepping on either of those character's territory? 

On another note, it's no secret that Mt. Targon was ravaged by a long-standing war between the Lunari and Solari. If Pantheon was to represent it, is there a chance his symbol might be the eclipse?

Personally I like to think {{champion:80}} would represent the mastery of combat through war.  {{champion:120}} represents the first charge of battle, the stampede of warriors coming in to slaughter the enemies.

Think of {{champion:120}} as the tides in the ocean of war.  Now think of {{champion:80}} as a ship captain in this sea.  He has and has mastered every single tool of war, using them to their most effectiveness as he sails through this turbulent ocean.  

As for design, I like to think of Bellona from Smite (Not outright copying of course):

http://hydra-media.cursecdn.com/smite.gamepedia.com/2/2c/T_Bellona_Default_Card.png?version=f5e0e6c14f9b542b6094e9036a4fd612

Bellona is basically a war god who changes weapons with her basic abilities.  She is a master of every tool of combat.  Hence an avatar of war should represent their mastery in not only their skill, but their attire.  I think {{champion:80}} would carry extra weapons with him, like actually soldiers (at least a short sword on his side).  

Unlike {{champion:131}} and {{champion:89}}, I imagine his actual armor wouldn't be too regal.  It would have something specific about it so people could identify his position, but it would need to be something that would be sensible to wear in combat.  I don't mean like a king/nobleman's armor that they wear to lead battles from a chariot.  But armor similar to his fellow soldiers.  

His symbol would probably be the Rakkor symbol, if not the fighter symbol (because what else works?).

I feel like part of his current "generic-ness" is from the traumatic incident that turned his head black and made his eyes glow. Does this mean he would gain a face if he was touched up? That sounds like a high-level conversation like the "Should GP have his hat" one.

You can take a look at previous visual updates such as Twitch, Sion, Gangplank and Poppy to get an idea of how VUs affect skins. We try to keep the thematic the same and just update the quality, while the base often changes more drastically.

Note Pantheon is not being VU'd at the moment, so it could be quite a while still.

Thanks for the response. That's a pretty big range in change though.

Sion was completely overhauled with no Traditional skin, Gangplank was changed dramatically but got a traditional skin.

Twitch and Poppy both had the feeling of fidelity upgrades rather than full visual reworks like Sion.

I just don't want another Fiora situation where I regret buying skins. Especially when traditional skins are on an "as we feel like it" basis.

We don't create traditional skins anymore. Gangplank was as strange exception because of the event where his new skin and his update were switched.

Skins team are a little more involved in the updates on champion's skins now. I think Lollipoppy is a good example of ensuring some of the charm of the old skin is respected in the update. Ultimately though taste is subjective, so just keep in mind that skins get updated along with the base.
Why was Poppy's anvil removed from her Blacksmith skin? I've never gotten an answer on it. That fact alone makes me regret having bought the skin.

I'm not sure, you can see in the [concept](http://orig09.deviantart.net/f726/f/2015/331/2/8/poppy_vu___blacksmith_poppy_by_knockwurst-d9i81cm.jpg) that the shape was still there so it must have been a decision based on 3D constraints such as her new animations.
Why would that hammer constrain her new animations? I have no idea about animations, so I'm a bit of a noob there. But with Lollipoppy the different hammer didn't seem to hurt that skins animations.

I don't know because I didn't work on it, but if the model is changed from the concept it's usually because of animation limitations. I'll let the champ up team know you miss the anvil though, it's good to get that kind of feedback so thank you!

I'm curious as to where you could foresee his Fullmetal skin going in terms of direction. Do you believe it could meet along the lines of FM Jayce with a processed voice to match, or maybe refine and rename it to a PROJECT skin with not only processed vo but added particles as well? Personally I have no idea what could happen to it, though I would like to see a processed vo at the very least (probably why I've mentioned it twice here).

In the past I don't think we've added new vfx or sound to old skins that didn't previously have them. There would be a conversation about whether to change it to look like FM Jayce/Rammus, or stay true to the almost 'junkyard' design of the original. I'm only guessing here but I think we'd be confident losing the scrappy element and instead making it look battle-worn.
So a possible renaming if that route is taken to help keep themes reatively the same? I don't own the skin, but I find the possibilites that could happen for this skin interesting
